alert.note: Alert for Cooke; Grayson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 16 at 5:27PM CDT until March 16 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN COOKE AND GRAYSON COUNTIES... At 527 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Lake Texoma to 8 miles east of Whitesboro to near Pilot Point, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Sherman, Whitesboro, Denison, Van Alstyne, Howe, Pottsboro, Collinsville, Gunter, Knollwood, Dorchester, Randell Lake, Lake Kiowa, Eisenhower State Park, Ray Roberts Park Johnson Branch, Lake Texoma, Preston, Southmayd, Tioga, Road Runner and Valley View. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for north central Texas.
